meanings.definition: To grow or shoot up again from a previous growth.
meanings.sent1: After the storm, the tree resprouted new leaves.
meanings.sent2: The plant resprouted quickly after being pruned.
meanings.sent3: The garden gnome was surprised to see the flowers resprouted overnight.
meanings.sent4: Hope resprouted in her heart like a resilient flower in a barren land.
meanings.sent5: The image of the green shoots resprouting was etched in her mind.

meanings.definition: To produce new growth after being cut or damaged.
meanings.sent1: The grass resprouted vigorously after the lawnmower passed.
meanings.sent2: The rose bush resprouted beautiful blooms after being pruned.
meanings.sent3: The soccer ball resprouted from the bushes, surprising the players.
meanings.sent4: Her determination resprouted like a phoenix from the ashes of failure.
meanings.sent5: The memory of her laughter resprouted in his mind, bringing a smile to his face.
